  • Post-marriage, Noella continues to use the surname Kambli.

  • Vinod Kambli's personal struggles, including alcohol addiction, influenced the end of their marriage.
  • Noella has gracefully moved on and is focused on her new career and philanthropic work.

title: "Game Will Stagnate...": India Team Management Member Warns Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli - Report - NDTV Sports
summary:
"Game Will Stagnate...": India Team Management Member Warns Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli - Report

Publication Date: December 30, 2024   Source: NDTV

The Indian cricket team's poor performance during the Test series against Australia has led to criticisms, especially towards the senior players Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. A team management source emphasizes the need for these players to actively engage in domestic cricket to regain their form.

  • Rohit Sharma scored only 31 runs in three matches and dropped himself from the final Test.
  • Virat Kohli struggled throughout the series, finishing with just 190 runs at an average of under 24.
  • Suggestions from cricket legends Sunil Gavaskar and Irfan Pathan encourage playing domestic games for better preparation.
  • A member of the team management highlighted the importance of regularly playing longer formats to avoid stagnation in their game.
“Without game time in the middle, their game will stagnate…”

Ravi Shastri weighs in on Kohli and Sharma's current situations, noting Kohli's issues with spin and technical faults. He believes that Kohli can still contribute significantly if he shares his experience with younger players.
newTitle: "Game Will Stagnate...": India Team Management Member Warns Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli - Report

Date: Jan 08, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Indian cricket team management emphasizes the need for Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma to return to domestic cricket to improve their game and avoid stagnation due to lack of play.

  • Kohli last played in the Ranji Trophy in 2012; Rohit hasn't played for nine years.

  • Expert opinions suggest domestic cricket could help players regain rhythm.

summary:
Sam Konstas Addresses Controversy with Jasprit Bumrah in Sydney

Publication Date: January 4, 2025   Source: NDTV

Australia's Sam Konstas has spoken out about his recent altercation with Jasprit Bumrah during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Sydney. The incident drew significant attention on social media, prompting Konstas to clarify his actions.

  • Konstas intervened in a situation involving Usman Khawaja and Bumrah, which led to Bumrah dismissing Khawaja immediately after.
  • Konstas regretted his intervention, stating that it was part of cricket and praised Bumrah's performance.
  • He also shared emotional reflections about the Pink Test and the significance of cancer awareness, citing personal losses in his family.
  • Gautam Gambhir, India’s head coach, criticized Konstas’ actions, emphasizing that he should not have engaged with Bumrah.
“Oh, I didn't get too fazed. Unfortunately, Uzi got out. He was trying to buy some time a little bit. It was probably my fault... Credit to Bumrah. He got the wicket.” - Sam Konstas

In light of the incident, Konstas expressed hopes of growing cancer awareness through events like the Pink Test, showing a blend of sporting rivalry and personal advocacy.
newTitle: Sam Konstas Addresses Controversy with Jasprit Bumrah in Sydney

title: Jasprit Bumrah's Champions Trophy fate in balance - The Times of India
summary:
Jasprit Bumrah's Champions Trophy Fate in Balance

Date: CHENNAI Source: Times of India

The future of pacer Jasprit Bumrah for the upcoming Champions Trophy hangs in the balance after he suffered injury during a Test match in Sydney. His condition will determine his participation in the tournament set to begin on February 20 in Dubai.

  • Bumrah suffered back spasms during the Test match, affecting his ability to bowl.
  • The provisional squad for the Champions Trophy will be announced soon.
  • If Bumrah's injury is a simple spasm, he may recover in time; a stress fracture would mean a longer rehabilitation.
  • Former players and trainers have differing opinions on whether Bumrah will be fit.
  • The condition of Bumrah's back will be closely monitored by his medical team.
"It does depend on the final diagnosis of the injury. Back spasm is normally an orange light, it tells you that something worse could be in store..."

Jasprit Bumrah's ability to recover from this injury is crucial not only for the Champions Trophy but also for the upcoming IPL season, where his performance will be critical for Mumbai Indians.
newTitle: Jasprit Bumrah's Champions Trophy Fate in Balance

title: "Go Back And...": Ravi Shastri Does Not Stutter, Gives Blunt Advice To Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma - NDTV Sports

Publication Date: October 17, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Former India coach Ravi Shastri has advised struggling cricketers Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma to return to domestic cricket as they face challenges in their careers.

  • Kohli and Rohit have had disappointing performances in 2024, particularly in Test matches.
  • Shastri believes they should play domestic cricket to regain form and contribute to younger players.
  • Rohit has not played a domestic match since 2016; Kohli since 2012.
  • Playing domestic cricket would help them improve their playing against spin, an area of struggle for India.
“If there's a gap for them, I think they should go back and play some domestic cricket and see how it is.” - Ravi Shastri

Shastri emphasizes the importance of playing domestic cricket not just for personal revival but for the future of Indian cricket, highlighting the need for engagement with the current generation.

Former Australia wicketkeeper Brad Haddin shared his opinions on Ashwin's surprising mid-series retirement during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, attributing it to Ashwin's frustration with not being picked for the playing XI in multiple Tests.

  • Ashwin announced his retirement after the Brisbane Test.
  • Haddin criticized India's lack of a clear plan for the series.
  • Ashwin was dropped after underwhelming performances in previous matches.
  • Brad Haddin remarked that Ashwin sees himself as India's top spinner and was unhappy with being benched.

'Bionic Man' Ben Stokes embarks on rehabilitation after hamstring surgery - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Ben Stokes Begins Rehabilitation After Hamstring Surgery

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Ben Stokes, England's Test captain, refers to himself as the 'Bionic Man' following his surgery for a torn left hamstring.

  • Stokes suffered a recurrence of his hamstring injury during the third Test against New Zealand in December.
  • His initial injury kept him sidelined for two months, causing him to miss England's home Test series against Sri Lanka.
  • He has committed to three months of recovery, missing the ICC Champions Trophy in the meantime.
  • Stokes shared a post-surgery photo on Instagram, captioning it, 'Bionic Man for a while.'
  • He recently bowled the most overs in a Test match since 2022 before sustaining the injury.
  • Stokes has also had to give up an £800,000 deal with MI Cape Town in the SA20.
“I have to work so much harder on the physical side of the job to allow me to go out and do my job.” - Ben Stokes

Stokes is determined to return stronger after his rehabilitation, facing a critical year ahead.

summary:

Publication Date: January 07, 2025, Source: News18

Jasprit Bumrah, the Indian pacer, is facing scrutiny over his bowling workload after a significant performance in the recent Border-Gavaskar Trophy series against Australia. Despite bowling 151.2 overs, he experienced a back spasm, raising concerns about management of his workload.

  • Bumrah dismissed 32 Australian batsmen during the series.
  • Critics blame the Indian team management for overusing him throughout the matches.
  • Former cricketer Balwinder Singh Sandhu dismisses workload management concerns as overly cautious.
  • Comparative analysis of overs bowled by Australian bowlers shows they managed higher workloads.
“Workload management is bull****. These are Australian terms created by Australians.” - Balwinder Singh Sandhu

This article reflects the ongoing debate surrounding player fitness and workload in cricket, highlighting differing opinions on how much a bowler should be expected to perform.
newTitle: Workload Concerns for Jasprit Bumrah in Cricket

title: Ricky Ponting shares his insights on Virat Kohli's performance in recently concluded BGT series 2024-25 - Hindustan Times
summary:
Ricky Ponting Discusses Virat Kohli's Test Performance in the BGT 2024-25

Date: Jan 07, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

ICC Hall of Famer Ricky Ponting shared insights on Virat Kohli's recent performance in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, highlighting his struggles amidst a decline in form.

  • Kohli ended the BGT series with 190 runs at an average of under 24.
  • Ponting noted Kohli's issues with spin and technical challenges against fast bowlers outside off-stump.
  • The former Australian captain compared Kohli's current struggles to his own experiences late in his career.
  • Ponting believes Kohli can still provide significant value as a mentor for younger players in the Indian team.
  • Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli faced criticism for their poor performances during the Test season.
“The challenge is, and I can see it with Virat now, you can see how much he wants it. He's trying so hard that actually makes batting harder.” - Ricky Ponting

Ponting's comments emphasize the mental aspects of batting that can affect players' performances, especially in challenging situations.
newTitle: Ricky Ponting Discusses Virat Kohli's Test Performance in the BGT 2024-25
